Probably one of the best games I have ever played. The original Portal was a blast but IMO, was too short and has lost its' playability for the most part unless you like speedrunning. Portal 2 has a solid length storyline and it is amazing, perfect dark humor throughout and lots of new mechanics like the portal gel changes the gameplay up a bit. There isn't a single thing wrong with this game, single player is amazing and to add to that, a cooperative mode with a different but general storyline makes playing with your friends a blast. Add in the use made portal levels you can go through and you've got an amazing game that will rarely lose its' replay value...now go buy it.

Fry your brain solo or with friends!

PLAY THE FIRST GAME BEFORE YOU PLAY THIS ONE! You won't truely understand the story and will lose alot of interest if you don't. To beat both it only took me about 14hrs, but with bonus maps, coop, and etc. you can play for much longer.
MY ADVICE.Play the campain for the first game then go straight into the campain for this game.
Don't rush through, listen to the dialogue when you got time.
Try and find all of the secrete rooms in the Game, they add soo much to the experience and story.
keep an eye on your surroundings, it is not always totally obvious that something has changed or what you got to do.
Don't stress and have Fun!

[h1][i]Cada vez que escucho la palabra ''perfección'' me acuerdo de este videojuego.[/i][/h1]

Esto es mucho más que un juego de puzles. De hecho, Portal 2 es mucho más que un videojuego. Debo reconocer que, durante mucho tiempo, me mostré reacio a jugarlo. No me parecía un juego de mi estilo, me parecía aburrido y demasiado austero. Estaba equivocado.

Si bien es cierto que Portal 2 tiene una estética muy minimalista, también hay que decir que su ambientación es sensacional y encaja perfectamente con la historia que se cuenta. Sí, Portal 2 tiene historia. Una historia muy sencilla pero tremendamente bien contada, llena de misterios y curiosidades. Realmente me sorprendió encontrarme con un argumento tan bien hilado en un juego de este tipo. Por cierto, hay sorpresa para los fans de Half-Life...

Además, gráficamente es una auténtica pasada. La limpieza de los entornos y el diseño de los mismos resulta muy gratificante. Eso por no hablar del diseño de los personajes...

Perdón, aún no he explicado de qué trata Portal 2 y en que basa su jugabilidad, ¿verdad?

Portal 2 es un videojuego basado en puzles, o que es lo mismo, un juego que pone a prueba nuestra habilidad mental a base de ciertas ''reglas'' y ''conceptos'' que se entrelazan para formar ''pruebas mentales''. Portal 2 se basa en una jugabilidad muy sencilla pero la exprime al máximo. En el juego deberemos superar una serie de puzles que se resuelven mediante las habilidades básicas de nuestro personaje (correr, saltar, agacharse) y también mediante un artefacto conocido como ''Pistola de portales''. Esta herramienta nos permite fabricar portales en ciertas superficies. En el juego hay dos tipos de portales: los azules y los naranjas. Al entrar por el portal azul saldrás por el naranja y viceversa. El objetivo de cada nivel es llegar a la puerta de salida usando estas habilidades.

Con estas sencillas premisas nos veremos obilgados a resolver intrincados puzles que se complicarán al avanzar en la aventura, añadiendo poco a poco nuevas mecánicas, nuevos artefactos y enemigos. Hay que decir también que el juego hace un uso magistral de las físicas, que en la mayoría de ocasiones serán la solución a nuestro problema.

Concretamente las pruebas ''Reencuentro nº5'' y ''El hormigueo nº11'' me resultaron muy enrevesadas, por lo que después de muchos intentos opté por consultar una guía. Algo totalmente comprensible, ya que el juego no escatima en dificultad.

Pero como ya he dicho antes, el juego no es únicamente una sucesión de ''pruebas'' que debemos superar. El juego tiene una historia. Resulta que somos una chica que desempeña su labor como sujeto de pruebas para una gran corporación científica. Durante nuestra hibernación, surgirá un problema inesperado y nos despertaremos rodeados por un panorama desolador: todos los demás sujetos de pruebas han muerto y han pasado muchísimos años desde que despertamos por última vez. La base de operaciones donde nos encontramos sufre de graves daños técnicos y un robot acude a nuestro rescate, Weathley. Este simpático robot, que tiene mucho más papel del que parece, nos guiará a través de las instalaciones y nos ayudará a resolver nuestros primeros puzles, necesarios para alcanzar la salida. No tarda en aparecer el némesis de nuestra protagonista: GlaDOS, una I.A. psicópata obsesionada con la venganza. Todo ello aderezado con un hilarante sentido del humor que nos arranca una sonrisa cada vez que Weathley o GlaDOS deciden intervenir con uno de sus monólogos.

Estos dos robots son la cereza sobre el pastel. Sus personalidades son increíblemente opuestas y tienen una química impresionante. Weathley el metepatas, con sus chistes malos y extravagancias y GlaDOS la psicópata, con sus maquinaciones y sarcasmos.

En definitiva, es original y muy interesante. Ofrece mucho más de lo que se puede ver a simple vista. Desde luego, es uno de los juegos más sorprendentes que he jugado en mi vida. Súper recomendable y divertido.

What can I say about this game that hasn't been said yet?. 
It's a wondrous game: the gameplay has improved since Portal 1, its story is quite compelling (it's more story-driven that the previous one), the dialogues are filled with funny jokes, plenty of challenging puzzles... - the list goes on and on. 
But where it really shines is with its co-op mode alongside the community chambers, giving to you and to your friends plenty of extended playtime!. 
If you are someone who enjoys puzzle games, this is a must have.
To sum up: Portal rules!.

GLaDOS has a delicious cake.

作为Valve的经典FPS之一，Portal与HL以及CS的风格截然相反：
没有紧张的对战，没有战术的考验。
玩家所感受到的只有清新的画面，充满未来感的机械，考验智商的机关，可爱的小炮塔，疯长了数万年的植物，拥有智慧的机器人，粘糊糊的凝胶以及虽已荒芜却仍然散发着科技魅力的光圈科技。

啊对，还有那个傲娇的GLaDOS（G姐我老婆）以及有着成熟男声的白痴惠特利。
这就是传送门的全部。
——但事实上不仅如此——
长达十余个小时的剧情和合作剧情带来的不仅仅是游戏的体验，给予我们留下更多的是疑惑与问题。
雪儿沉睡了多久？
鼠人到底怎样了？
光圈人疯狂的追求科技真的必要吗？
以无数员工的生命为代价来试验传送门（二代光圈）是否合理呢？
雪儿到底是不是GLaDOS的女儿呢？
这些未解的东西也许要留在我们不一定看到，也不一定会有的Portal 3里才能了解吧。
（但愿G胖会数3）

Portal 2 will remain one of my favorite games of all the time.This was the first game that made me tear up at the ending because I wanted more of it.Anyways heres a rundown on the pros and cons of this game.
PROS
+Fun puzzles: They give you that "Aha!" moment when you finally solve them
+Nice writing: Made me laugh out loud a couple times
+Fun/Frustrating co-op:Tried it with my little brother it was aggravatingly fun(lots of shouting)
CONS
-A bit short: Took me about 10-12 hours to finsh it (achievments could increase replayability)
-No portal 3: I don't want HL3 valve I want portal 3!
Overall this game is great, esspecialy get it during sales since its dirt cheap during them.

Portal 2 is as much of a bigger step up to the original as Half-Life 2 was a bigger step up to the original. The sequal starts off with Chell waking up in what appears to be an ordinary motel room except it is as much of a prison as her old holding cell when the doors and windows are locked shut. Chell was then being given exercise orders by the A.I. announcer in the room after learning that she was in suspended animation for 50 days. The confindment of the room was getting to Chell as much as her ordeal with Glados. Before she could try to manage an escape, Chell black out and reawoken again only to discover that she was in suspended animation for an unknown number of years due to the evidents of the decayed motel room. She hears a knock at the door of what appears to be the voice of a human, only to learn that it's a small A.I. who is trying to release her from confindment. Turns out that the motel room is a fake and Chell is still a prisoner of Aperture Laboritories. Her only oppurtunity to escape from the facility is with the help of Wheatley the A.I. who released her from her faux motel room. As they make their way to the exit of the facility, Chell notices how bad the structure of Aperture has gotten when nature is trying to retake its place and varius test chambers are disfunctional. The place has become comparible to Black Mesa, but luckily Chell doesn't have to worry about any Xem aliens. Upon arrival to an escape pod, it seem that Chell and Wheatley are bound for route to the surface. But when Wheatley tried to activate the escape pod, he accidently reactivated Glados who's memory banks of her last recorded moments were restored. Chell soon becomes a test rat for Glados's variety of tests and traps. Will Chell ever see the light of day again? The graphics are slightly up a notch and the additional test chamber obstacles and objects not present from the last game are great additions to provide in the game. The thing I love most about the game is that you finally learn the history of Aperture Labs and the Co-Op mode is a great idea for those who like getting a friend to play. With all that is offered to the game as I noted prior, any first person gamer or Valve fan will gladly accepted Portal 2 as a great addition to their Half-Life & Counter Strike games. A sequal that is fun from beginning to end.

[h1] Recommendation [/h1] Recommended
 
[h1] Base Game Score [/h1] A+
 
[h1] Style [/h1] Puzzle
 
[h1] Recommendation Summary [/h1] Portal 2 is a puzzle game with some great comedy. You play as a test subject, who uses a gun which opens 2 portals. These portals are used to solve puzzles. It builds immensely upon the original Portal with not only better graphics and a more detailed enviroment, but with amazing characters. The plot has it's twists, and is great, as it is really fleshed out. It is amazing to experience first hand. You can also play Co-op and also build your own puzzles and play other people's puzzles. All around an amazing experience, and a must play for any serious gamer.
